p: Detailed bond lengths and angles are provided in the Supporting Information. For the sake of simplicity, the different Co atoms will from now‐on be termed Co 6 and Co [5by], respectively, according to Machatschki's terminology. 10 Figure 2 a shows the single‐crystal structure composed from alternating layers of phosphate tetrahedra colored in magenta and Co polyhedra in bronze. The latter are connected through corners and edges to their adjacent Co polyhedra (Figure 2 b).
